Class CSVWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.util.table.writer.AbstractTableWriter

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, TableWriter

    public class CSVWriter
extends AbstractTableWriter
    Implementation of TableWriter for CSV files.

                 java.io.Writer w,
                 @Nullable
                 TableLayout l)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Construct a new CSV writer.
        Parameters:
        w - The underlying writer to output to.
        l - The table layout, or null if the table has no headers.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error writing the column headers.

      • writeRow

        public void writeRow(java.util.List<?> row)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: TableWriter
        Write a row to the table. This method is thread-safe.
        Parameters:
        row - A row of values. If the table requires more columns, the remaining columns are empty. The row is copied if necessary; the caller is free to re-use the same array for returnValue calls.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs writing the row.

        Description copied from interface: TableWriter

        Returns:

      • open

        public static CSVWriter open(java.io.File file,
                             TableLayout layout,
                             CompressionMode compression)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Open a CSV writer to write to a file.
        Parameters:
        file - The file to write to.
        layout - The layout of the table.
        compression - What compression, if any, to use.
        Returns:
        A CSV writer outputting to file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error opening the file or writing the column header.

      • open

        public static CSVWriter open(java.io.File file,
                             @Nullable
                             TableLayout layout)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Open a CSV writer to write to an auto-compressed file. The file will be compressed if its name ends in ".gz".
        Parameters:
        file - The file.
        layout - The table layout.
        Returns:
        The CSV writer.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error opening the file or writing the column header.
        See Also:
        open(File, TableLayout, CompressionMode)
